intro: Delphinium azureum, commonly known as the Azure Larkspur, is a herbaceous perennial native to the mountainous regions of Europe. It is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stems that bear clusters of striking blue to violet flowers. The plant has lance-shaped, dark green leaves that are arranged oppositely along the stem. Its flowers are typically 1–2 inches long and feature five petals, with the upper petal forming a distinctive hood. Delphinium azureum prefers well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and alpine settings.
